html:
Peloton, Bowflex, Echelon, and Sunny bikes are on sale this Prime Day.

We may earn a commission from links on this page.

Credit: Product image courtesy of Amazon

If you’re looking to pick up an exercise bike, Amazon has deals on several brands for October Prime Day. These include deals on Peloton bikes and shoes, Bowflex and Echelon bikes, and deals on several Sunny models. Unfortunately for non-Prime members, the big-name bikes are for members only. But don’t stop reading—we have the dirt on some of the best discounts on lesser-known brands that will be available for everyone.

Peloton

Both the original Bike and the Bike+ are on sale. The original Bike is down $1,228.24 (from $1,445) and the Bike+ is $1,995 (down from $2,495).

If you're not sure whether you want the Bike or the Bike+, we have a breakdown here of the differences between them. Both are the same size, and can access the same class content and training programs with a $44/month All-Access subscription. The Bike+ has a larger screen, updated tech (so the screen feels faster and more responsive), and it can automatically adjust your pedaling resistance to match what the instructor is calling out.

Some Peloton accessories are also on sale. Peloton’s regular shoes, single-strap Altos shoes, and their signature square-ended dumbbells are between 15-40% off. (Note that you may need to select a size on the shoes to see the sale price.)

Sunny

Sunny makes some of the most popular budget-friendly exercise bikes, and several models are on sale for Prime Day. Besides the deals highlighted below, Sunny is also running discounts on some of its lower-end bikes, like this upright exercise bike for $153 (down from $199.99) and this one for $238 (down from $269.00). They also have an under-desk pedaler that can double as a tabletop arm bike for just $108 (down from $149.99).
